markerTextCmdHdr.Title: Text
markerTextCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Adds text, linked to a particular part or portion of the context. This marker changes its position according to the changes in the viewpoint.
markerTextCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area.
  2. Edit the text as required.
  3. Drag the annotation to position it precisely.
  4. Customize the annotation using the contextual commands.
markerCircleCmdHdr.Title: Circle
markerCircleCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Circles items to draw attention to a particular part or portion of the context.
markerCircleCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area to position the center of the circle.
  2. Drag the manipulator on the circle's border to re-size it, and move its center point to reposition it.
  3. Customize the graphic properties of the circle.
markerArrowCmdHdr.Title: Arrow
markerArrowCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Creates an arrow to draw attention to a particular part or portion of the context.
markerArrowCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area to position the tip of the arrow.
  2. Define the orientation and size. To position its anchor point precisely, drag the arrow.
  3. Customize the graphic properties of the arrow.
markerPictureCmdHdr.Title: Picture
markerPictureCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Inserts a picture, linked to a particular part or portion of the context. This marker changes its position according to the changes in the viewpoint.
markerPictureCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click to position the anchor point of the picture, and then either take a picture or browse to select an existing picture.
  2. Use the manipulators and the context toolbar to customize the position and appearance of this annotation.
marker2DTextCmdHdr.Title: 2D Text
marker2DTextCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Adds a text marker that is not linked to any object. This marker does not change its position according to the changes in the viewpoint.
marker2DTextCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area.
  2. Edit the text as required.
  3. Drag the annotation to position it precisely.
  4. Customize the annotation using the contextual commands.
marker2DPictureCmdHdr.Title: 2D Picture
marker2DPictureCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Inserts a picture that is not linked to any object. This marker does not change its position according to the changes in the viewpoint.
marker2DPictureCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click to position the anchor point of the picture, and then either take a picture or browse to select an existing picture.
  2. Use the manipulators and the context toolbar to customize the position and appearance of this annotation.
DMU3DRectangleCmdHdr.Title: Rectangle
DMU3DRectangleCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Creates a rectangle enclosing selected items to draw attention to a particular part or portion of the context.
DMU3DRectangleCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area to position the center of the rectangle.
  2. Drag the manipulator on the rectangleâ€™s border to re-size it, and move its center point to reposition it.
  3. Customize the graphic properties of the rectangle.
DMUFreehandCmdHdr.Title: Freehand
DMUFreehandCmdHdr.ShortHelp: Creates a freehand annotation to draw attention to a particular part or portion of the context.
DMUFreehandCmdHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area to start the drawing.
  2. Drag the manipulator on the container's border to re-size it, and move its center point to reposition it.
  3. Customize the graphic properties of the marker.
Marker_DMUArrowLeaderHdr.Title: Arrow
Marker_DMUArrowLeaderHdr.ShortHelp: Set the Arrow leader end type.
Marker_DMUNoLeaderHdr.Title: No Leader
Marker_DMUBubbleLeaderHdr.Title: Bubble
Marker_DMUBubbleLeaderHdr.ShortHelp: Set the Bubble leader end type.
Marker_DMUNoEndLeaderHdr.Title: No End
DMUMarkerShortDisplayHdr.Title: Display/Hide additional information
DMUMarkerShortDisplayHdr.ShortHelp: Display or Hide picture name and creation date.
DMUCreateRejectedMkrHdr.Title: Rejected
DMUCreateRejectedMkrHdr.ShortHelp: Create 'Rejected marker' linked to a particular part or portion of the context.
DMUCreateRejectedMkrHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area.
  2. Edit the text as required.
  3. Drag the annotation to position it precisely.
  4. Customize the annotation using the contextual commands.
DMUCreateValidatedMkrHdr.Title: Validated
DMUCreateValidatedMkrHdr.ShortHelp: Create 'Validated marker' linked to a particular part or portion of the context.
DMUCreateValidatedMkrHdr.LongHelp:
1. Click an object in the 3D area.
  2. Edit the text as required.
  3. Drag the annotation to position it precisely.
  4. Customize the annotation using the contextual commands.
